name: Spinach and Endive Salad With Kasha and Mushrooms
description: Kasha is not the main ingredient here, so I wouldn’t call this a grain salad, but rather a substantial leafy green salad with grain. I love pairing this nutty grain with both cooked and raw spinach, and with walnuts and walnut oil. Kasha also goes well with foods that have a bitter edge, like endive, so I included some in the salad.
recipeCategory: dinner, lunch, salads and dressings, vegetables
keywords: fall, spring, winter, gluten-free, halal, kosher, low cholesterol, low-sodium, low sugar, vegetarian, side dish
recipeIngredient: 1 6-ounce bag baby spinach, washed and spun dry
4 to 6 white or cremini mushrooms (to taste and depending on size), sliced thin
2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill, or a combination of dill, parsley, and chives

recipeInstructions.text: In a large salad bowl, toss together spinach kasha, mushrooms, fresh herbs, endives, walnuts and feta.
In a small bowl or measuring cup whisk together lemon juice, vinegar, salt, pepper, Dijon mustard, garlic, walnut oil and olive oil. Toss with the salad and serve.
